{{Infobox set | image = DCR-BoosterNA.png | en_name = Dark Crisis | fr_name = La Crise des Ténèbres | de_name = Dark Crisis | it_name = Crisi Oscura | ko_name = 암흑의 위협 | hanja_name = | ko_rr_name = Amheug-ui Wihyeop | type = [[Booster pack]] | series = Core Booster | size = 106 | cover_card = Exodia Necross | en_database_id = 11102004 | fr_database_id = 31106006 | de_database_id = 21106006 | it_database_id = 41106006 | ko_database_id = 71103000 | ae_database_id = 5000000013000 | prefix = DCR | na_prefix = DCR | ae_prefix = DCR | other_sets = ''Dark Crisis'' promotional cards | ae_release_date = May 13, 2004 | kr_release_date = May 2, 2005 | na_release_date = December 1, 2003 | en_release_date = December 12, 2007 | de_release_date = December 10, 2007 | fr_release_date = December 10, 2007 | it_release_date = December 10, 2007 | isbn = 1-932241-87-6 | ean = 0-053334-323970 | prev = Magician's Force | next = Invasion of Chaos }} '''''Dark Crisis''''' is a [[Core Booster]], which combines the Japanese sets ''[[Power of the Guardian]]'' and ''[[Threat of the Dark Demon World]]''. It is the ninth worldwide Booster Pack. It has been released in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game]]'' (''TCG'') in English and in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Official Card Game]]'' (''OCG'') in [[Asian-English]] and [[Korean]]. The English ''TCG'' has two different prints, one with set numbers DCR-### and one with DCR-EN###, the second of which were available through ''[[Gladiator's Assault: Special Edition]]''. In 2010, an [[Unlimited Edition]] North American version of the set (DCR-###) was reprinted again and released in ''[[Legendary Collection]]''. ==Features== ''Dark Crisis'' introduces the [[archetype]]s "[[Guardian]]" and "[[Archfiend]]" to the ''TCG''. Highly sought-after cards include "[[Vampire Lord]]", "[[D.D. Warrior Lady]]", "[[Butterfly Dagger - Elma]]", and "[[Terrorking Archfiend]]". ==Breakdown== In the English and Asian-English versions of this set, each pack contains 9 cards and each box contains 24 packs. In the Korean version, there are 5 cards per pack. The set contains 106 cards, including: * 2 [[Secret Rare]] * 10 [[Ultra Rare]] * 10 [[Super Rare]] * 17 [[Rare]] * 67 [[Common]] ==Galleries== {{Main|Miscellaneous Gallery:Dark Crisis}} DCR-BoosterEN.png | English
[[Set Card Galleries:Dark Crisis (TCG-EN-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] DCR-BoosterNA.png | North American
[[Set Card Galleries:Dark Crisis (TCG-NA-1E)|1st Edition]] / [[Set Card Galleries:Dark Crisis (TCG-NA-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] DCR-BoosterFR.jpg | French
[[Set Card Galleries:Dark Crisis (TCG-FR-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] DCR-BoosterDE.jpg | German
[[Set Card Galleries:Dark Crisis (TCG-DE-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] DCR-BoosterIT.jpg | Italian
[[Set Card Galleries:Dark Crisis (TCG-IT-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] DCR-BoosterAE.jpg | Asian-English
[[Set Card Galleries:Dark Crisis (OCG-AE-1E)|1st Edition]] DCR-BoosterKR.jpg | Korean
[[Set Card Galleries:Dark Crisis (OCG-KR-1E)|1st Edition]] / [[Set Card Galleries:Dark Crisis (OCG-KR-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] ==Lists== {{Set navigation | lists = EN,NA,FR,DE,IT,AE,KR | 1e_galleries = NA,AE,KR | ue_galleries = EN,NA,FR,DE,IT,KR }} {{Set list tabs|EN,NA,FR,DE,IT,AE,KR}} {{Core Boosters}} [[Category:International Core Boosters]]

{{Infobox set | image = RDS-BoosterEN.png | en_name = Rise of Destiny | fr_name = Avènement du Destin | de_name = Rise of Destiny | it_name = Ascesa del Destino | pt_name = Ascenção do Destino | es_name = Auge del Destino | ja_name = ライズ・オブ・デスティニー | romaji_name = Raizu Obu Desutinī | ko_name = 운명의 시작 | hanja_name = | ko_rr_name = Unmyeong-ui Sijak | type = [[Booster Pack]] | series = Core Booster | size = 60 | cover_card = [[The Creator]] | ja_database_id = 1107001 | en_database_id = 11103005 | fr_database_id = 31103003 | de_database_id = 21103003 | it_database_id = 41103003 | pt_database_id = 11103005 | es_database_id = 51102003 | ko_database_id = 71104000 | ae_database_id = 5000000020000 | order_number = 402 | prefix = RDS | fr_prefix = RDS-FR | it_prefix = RDS-IT | pt_prefix = RDS-PT | sp_prefix = RDS-SP | ae_prefix = RDS-AE | vendor_edition = yes | special_edition = yes | ae_release_date = July 21, 2005 | jp_release_date = August 5, 2004 | kr_release_date = February 7, 2006 | en_release_date = December 1, 2004 | eu_release_date = | oc_release_date = | fr_release_date = November 1, 2004 | de_release_date = December 1, 2004 | it_release_date = December 1, 2004 | pt_release_date = December 1, 2004 | sp_release_date = November 1, 2004 | prev = Soul of the Duelist | next = Flaming Eternity }} '''''Rise of Destiny''''' is a [[Core Booster]] in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Official Card Game]]'' (''OCG'') and ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game]]'' (''TCG''). It is the second Core Booster of [[Series 4]]. The set has been released in the ''TCG'' in English, French, German, Italian, Portuguese and Spanish and in the ''OCG'' in Japanese, [[Asian-English]] and Korean. ''Rise of Destiny'' was the first Core Booster to have a [[Sneak Preview]] event, held on November 20 to 21, 2004,{{cite web |title=UPPER DECK ENTERTAINMENT INVITES Yu-Gi-Oh! TRADING CARD GAME DUELISTS TO SNEAK A PEEK AT RISE OF DESTINY |url=https://www.pojo.com/yu-gi-oh/News/2004/10-21.shtml |website=Pojo's YU-GI-OH! News |publisher=Pojo |date=October 21, 2004}} although it did not issue any [[Sneak Peek Participation Cards|participation cards]]. It was also the last Core Booster to feature [[Yami Yugi]] on the cover. In the ''TCG'', this set was also released in the ''[[Rise of Destiny: Special Edition]]''. This is one of the four Booster Packs combined into ''[[Dark Revelation Volume 3]]''. ==Features== {{Quote|Expand the fantasy with the ultimate creations, and expand your game with more LV monsters and deadly Machines. The 13th booster contains "The Creator" which can bring your monsters back from the Graveyard, and marks the return of the Harpie Ladies with powerful new support cards. 9 cards per pack with 60 cards to collect. Rise of Destiny continues the new alternate Ultimate Rare foil card, find all 25! |source=Upper Deck Entertainment{{fact}}}} * Includes cards used by [[Mai Valentine]], [[Crump]], [[Nezbitt]] and [[Rafael]] . * Includes members and/or support for the "[[Harpie]]" and "[[Mokey Mokey]]" archetypes, as well as the [[Sasuke Samurai]] series. * Introduces the "[[B.E.S.]]" archetype to the OCG/TCG. ==Breakdown== In the Japanese version, each pack contained 5 cards and each box contained 30 packs. In the ''TCG'' and Asian-English version, each pack contained 9 cards and each box contained 24 packs. In the Korean version, each pack contained 5 cards. In the Japanese version, the set contains 60 cards, or 71 in the [[Master Set]]. This is comprised of: * 11 [[Ultimate Rare]] * 4 [[Ultra Rare]] * 7 [[Super Rare]] * 14 [[Rare]] * 30 [[Common]] In the ''TCG'', Asian-English and Korean versions, the set contained 60 cards or 85 in the Master Set. This is comprised of: * 25 [[Ultimate Rare]] * 4 [[Ultra Rare]] * 7 [[Super Rare]] * 14 [[Rare]] * 35 [[Common]] ==Galleries== RDS-BoosterEN.png | English
[[Set Card Galleries:Rise of Destiny (TCG-EN-1E)|1st Edition]] / [[Set Card Galleries:Rise of Destiny (TCG-EN-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] RDS-BoosterFR.jpg | French

Duelist|175|ref}}. ==External links== * [http://www.db.yugioh-card.com/yugiohdb/card_search.action?ope=1&pid=161601115&request_locale=en db.yugioh-card.com] ''Rise of Destiny'' * [http://www.db.yugioh-card.com/yugiohdb/card_search.action?ope=1&pid=1107001&request_locale=ja db.yugioh-card.com] ''Rise of Destiny'' {{icon|Japanese}} * [http://web.archive.org/web/20090226215949/http://entertainment.upperdeck.com/yugioh/en/products/boosters/RDS.aspx entertainment.upperdeck.com] ''Rise of Destiny'' {{icon|archive}} * [http://konami-asia.com/th/yugi/lineup/en/duel_monsters/asia12 konami-asia.com] ''Rise of Destiny'' - Asian-English * [http://konami-asia.com/th/yugi/lineup/en/duel_monsters/riseof konami-asia.com] ''Rise of Destiny'' - Japanese * [http://www.yugioh.co.kr/01/01_03.php yugioh.co.kr] Booster Packs {{icon|Korean}} ==References== {{Core Boosters}} [[Category:OCG Core Boosters]] [[Category:TCG Core Boosters]]

{{Infobox set | image = AST-BoosterEN.png | width = | en_name = Ancient Sanctuary | fr_name = Sanctuaire Ancestra | de_name = Ancient Sanctuary | it_name = Antico Santuario | pt_name = Santuário Antigo | es_name = Santuario Antiguo | ko_name = 천공의 성역 | hanja_name = | ko_rr_name = Cheon-gong-ui Seong-yeok | type = [[Booster Pack]] | series = Core Booster | size = 112 | cover_card = [[Archlord Zerato]] | en_database_id = 11103001 | fr_database_id = 31103000 | de_database_id = 21103000 | it_database_id = 41103000 | pt_database_id = 11103001 | es_database_id = 51102000 | ko_database_id = 71103002 | ae_database_id = 5000000017000 | en_prefix = AST | fr_prefix = AST-FR | de_prefix = AST-DE | it_prefix = AST-IT | pt_prefix = AST-PT | sp_prefix = AST-SP | ae_prefix = AST-AE | kr_prefix = AST-KR | other_sets = ''Ancient Sanctuary'' promotional cards | ae_release_date = October 14, 2004 | kr_release_date = August 27, 2005 | na_release_date = June 1, 2004 | eu_release_date = | oc_release_date = | fr_release_date = June 1, 2004 | de_release_date = May 1, 2004 | it_release_date = June 1, 2004 | pt_release_date = June 1, 2004 | sp_release_date = June 1, 2004 | prev = Invasion of Chaos | next = Soul of the Duelist }} '''''Ancient Sanctuary''''' is a [[Core Booster]], which is a combination of the Japanese sets ''[[The Sanctuary in the Sky (set)|The Sanctuary in the Sky]]'' and ''[[Pharaoh's Inheritance]]''. It has been released in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game]]'' (''TCG'') in English, French, German, Italian, Portuguese and Spanish and in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Official Card Game]]'' (''OCG'') in [[Asian-English]] and [[Korean]]. This series is the last [[Core Booster]] in the ''TCG'', Asian-English and Korean, prior to their convergence with the Japanese Booster Pack releases. As such it is the last to follow the format of having 2 [[Secret Rare]], 10 [[Ultra Rare]] and 10 [[Super Rare]] cards. In the ''TCG'', this set became legal for premier events on July 1, 2004.{{cite web |title=UDE Tournament Appendix Appendix A: Yu-Gi-Oh! TCG Policies |url=http://www.upperdeckentertainment.com/op/policy/files/UDEAppendixAYGO10may2004.txt |publisher=Upper Deck Entertainment |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20040722193543/http://www.upperdeckentertainment.com/op/policy/files/UDEAppendixAYGO10may2004.txt |archive-date=22 July 2004 |format=txt |date=May 10, 2004}} This is one of the two Booster Packs combined into ''[[Dark Revelation Volume 2]]''. ==Features== ''Ancient Sanctuary'' focuses mainly on [[Fairy]]-[[Type]] [[Monster Cards|monsters]], including the "[[The Agent]]" monsters, which have powerful effects when the card "[[The Sanctuary in the Sky]]" is in play. [[Yami Yugi]]'s appearance on the cover of this booster pack is taken from the title page for {{chapter|Yu-Gi-Oh! Duelist|148|ref}}. This was also used earlier for ''[[Struggle of Chaos]]'' and ''[[Duelist Legacy Volume.5]]''. ==Breakdown== In the ''TCG'' and Asian-English versions of this set, each pack contains 9 cards and each box contains 24 packs. In the Korean version, each pack contains 5 cards. The set contains 112 cards. This is comprised of: * 2 [[Secret Rare]] * 10 [[Ultra Rare]] * 10 [[Super Rare]] * 17 [[Rare]] * 73 [[Common]] ==Galleries== AST-BoosterEN.png | North American
[[Set Card Galleries:Ancient Sanctuary (TCG-NA-1E)|1st Edition]] / [[Set Card Galleries:Ancient Sanctuary (TCG-NA-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] AST-BoosterFR.png | French
[[Set Card Galleries:Ancient Sanctuary (TCG-FR-1E)|1st Edition]] / [[Set Card Galleries:Ancient Sanctuary (TCG-FR-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] AST-BoosterDE.png | German
[[Set Card Galleries:Ancient Sanctuary (TCG-DE-1E)|1st Edition]] / [[Set Card Galleries:Ancient Sanctuary (TCG-DE-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] AST-BoosterIT.png | Italian
[[Set Card Galleries:Ancient Sanctuary (TCG-IT-1E)|1st Edition]] / [[Set Card Galleries:Ancient Sanctuary (TCG-IT-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] AST-BoosterPT.png | Portuguese
[[Set Card Galleries:Ancient Sanctuary (TCG-PT-1E)|1st Edition]] AST-BoosterSP.png | Spanish
[[Set Card Galleries:Ancient Sanctuary (TCG-SP-1E)|1st Edition]] / [[Set Card Galleries:Ancient Sanctuary (TCG-SP-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] AST-BoosterAE.png | Asian-English
[[Set Card Galleries:Ancient Sanctuary (OCG-AE-1E)|1st Edition]] AST-BoosterKR.png | Korean
[[Set Card Galleries:Ancient Sanctuary (OCG-KR-1E)|1st Edition]] / [[Set Card Galleries:Ancient Sanctuary (OCG-KR-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] AST-Poster-EN.png | English promotional poster ==Lists== {{Set navigation | lists = NA,FR,DE,IT,PT,SP,AE,KR | 1e_galleries = NA,FR,DE,IT,PT,SP,AE,KR | ue_galleries = NA,FR,DE,IT,SP,KR }} {{Set list tabs|NA,FR,DE,IT,PT,SP,AE,KR}} ==References== {{Core Boosters}} [[Category:International Core Boosters]]

{{Infobox set | image = SOD-BoosterEN.png | width = | en_name = Soul of the Duelist | fr_name = L'Ame du Duelliste | de_name = Soul of the Duelist | it_name = Anima del Duellante | pt_name = Alma do Duelista | es_name = Alma del Duelista | ja_name = ソウル・オブ・ザ・デュエリスト | romaji_name = Souru Obu Za Dyuerisuto | ko_name = 듀얼리스트의 투혼 | hanja_name = | ko_rr_name = Dyueolliseuteuui Tuhon | type = [[Booster Pack]] | series = Core Booster | size = 60 | cover_card = [[Horus the Black Flame Dragon LV8]] | ja_database_id = 1107000 | en_database_id = 11103003 | fr_database_id = 31103002 | de_database_id = 21103002 | it_database_id = 41103002 | pt_database_id = 11103003 | es_database_id = 51102002 | ko_database_id = 71103003 | ae_database_id = 5000000018000 | vendor_edition = yes | order_number = 401 | prefix = SOD | fr_prefix = SOD-FR | it_prefix = SOD-IT | pt_prefix = SOD-PT | sp_prefix = SOD-SP | ae_prefix = SOD-AE | ae_release_date = April 21, 2005 | jp_release_date = May 27, 2004 | kr_release_date = November 4, 2005 | en_release_date = October 1, 2004 | eu_release_date = | oc_release_date = | fr/de/it/sp_release_date = October 1, 2004 | pt_release_date = October 1, 2004 | prev = * ''[[Pharaoh's Inheritance]]'' (Japanese) * ''[[Ancient Sanctuary]]'' (Worldwide) | next = Rise of Destiny }} '''''Soul of the Duelist''''' is a [[Core Booster]] in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Official Card Game]]'' (''OCG'') and ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game]]'' (''TCG''). It is the first Core Booster of [[Series 4]]. It is the first Core Booster after the convergence of Japanese Booster Pack releases with ''TCG'', [[Asian-English]] and Korean releases. Previously one set of Booster Packs was being released in Japanese, while other languages received separate Booster Packs, which were usually an amalgamation of two of the Japanese Booster Packs. It has been released in the ''OCG'' in Japanese, [[Asian-English]] and Korean and in the ''TCG'' in English, French, German, Italian, Portuguese and Spanish. ''Soul of the Duelist'' is one of the four Booster Packs combined into ''[[Dark Revelation Volume 3]]''. ==Structure changes== Due to the convergence of releases, this became the first Core Booster in the ''TCG'', Asian-English and Korean to follow the Japanese format. This included having 4 [[Ultra Rare]] and 7 [[Super Rare]] cards in the set, following the [[Core Booster rainbow|Core Booster color pattern]], having cards printed with more than one rarity, namely [[Ultimate Rare]]. This is the first ''TCG'', Asian-English and Korean Booster Pack to not contain [[Secret Rare]]s. This is the first English set to use "EN" in its set numbers (SOD-EN###). A number of earlier sets were later reprinted to follow this pattern too. ==Features== * Includes cards used by [[Yami Yugi]], and [[Arkana]]. * Includes members and/or support for the "[[Ojama]]" archetype. * Introduces the "[[LV]]" archetype, to the OCG/TCG. * This set introduced "[[LV]]" monsters, including the "[[Horus]]", "[[Armed Dragon]]" and "[[Mystic Swordsman]]" [[series]]. * It introduced the strongest [[Fusion Monster]] in the ''TCG'' at the time, "[[Master of Oz]]". ==Breakdown== In the Japanese version, each pack contained 5 cards and each box contained 30 packs. In the ''TCG'' and Asian-English versions, each pack contained 9 cards and each box contained 24 packs. In the Korean version, each pack contained 5 cards. In the Japanese version, the set contains 60 cards, or 71 in the [[Master Set]]. This consists of: * 11 [[Ultimate Rare]] * 4 [[Ultra Rare]] * 7 [[Super Rare]] * 14 [[Rare]] * 35 [[Common]] In the ''TCG'', Asian-English and Korean version, the set contains 60 cards or 85 in the Master Set. This consists of: * 25 [[Ultimate Rare]] * 4 [[Ultra Rare]] * 7 [[Super Rare]] * 14 [[Rare]] * 35 [[Common]] ==Galleries== {{Main|Miscellaneous Gallery:Soul of the Duelist}} SOD-BoosterEN.png | English
[[Set Card Galleries:Soul of the Duelist (TCG-EN-1E)|1st Edition]] / [[Set Card Galleries:Soul of the Duelist (TCG-EN-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] SOD-BoosterFR.png | French

[[Set Card Galleries:Soul of the Duelist (OCG-KR-1E)|1st Edition]] / [[Set Card Galleries:Soul of the Duelist (OCG-KR-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] SOD-Poster-JP.png | Japanese promotional poster ==Lists== {{Set navigation | lists = EN,FR,DE,IT,PT,SP,JP,AE,KR | 1e_galleries = EN,FR,DE,IT,PT,SP,AE,KR | ue_galleries = EN,FR,DE,IT,PT,SP,JP,KR }} {{Set list tabs|EN,FR,DE,IT,PT,SP,JP,AE,KR}} ==External links== * [http://www.db.yugioh-card.com/yugiohdb/card_search.action?ope=1&pid=161601113&request_locale=en db.yugioh-card.com] ''Soul of the Duelist'' * [http://www.db.yugioh-card.com/yugiohdb/card_search.action?ope=1&pid=1107000&request_locale=ja db.yugioh-card.com] ''Soul of the Duelist'' {{icon|Japanese}} * [http://web.archive.org/web/20090226215954/http://entertainment.upperdeck.com/yugioh/en/products/boosters/SOD.aspx entertainment.upperdeck.com] ''Soul of the Duelist'' {{icon|archive}} * [http://konami-asia.com/th/yugi/lineup/en/duel_monsters/asia11 konami-asia.com] ''Soul of the Duelist'' - Asian-English * [http://konami-asia.com/th/yugi/lineup/en/duel_monsters/soulof konami-asia.com] ''Soul of the Dueilst'' - Japanese * [http://www.yugioh.co.kr/01/01_03.php yugioh.co.kr] Booster Packs {{icon|Korean}} {{Core Boosters}} [[Category:OCG Core Boosters]] [[Category:TCG Core Boosters]]

{{Infobox set | image = LOD-BoosterNA.png | en_name = Legacy of Darkness | ko_name = 어둠의 유산 | hanja_name = | ko_rr_name = Eodum-ui Yusan | type = [[Booster Pack]] | series = Core Booster | size = 101 | prefix = LOD | na_prefix = LOD | ae_prefix = LOD | cover_card = [[Last Turn]] | en_database_id = 11102001 | ko_database_id = 71102004 | ae_database_id = 5000000010000 | other_sets = ''Legacy of Darkness'' promotional cards | ae_release_date = September 18, 2003 | kr_release_date = October 18, 2004 | en_release_date = December 1, 2004 | na_release_date = June 6, 2003 | eu_release_date = | oc_release_date = | prev = Labyrinth of Nightmare | next = Pharaonic Guardian }} '''''Legacy of Darkness''''' is a [[Core Booster]], which is an amalgamation of the Japanese sets ''[[Struggle of Chaos]]'' and ''[[Mythological Age]]''. It was released in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game]]'' (''TCG'') in English and in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Official Card Game]]'' (''OCG'') in [[Asian-English]] and [[Korean]]. The official database also lists a German release.{{database link|set|21102001|Legacy of Darkness|lang=de}} In the ''TCG'', this set became legal for Constructed tournaments on July 8, 2003.{{cite web |title=Duelist King Tournament |url=http://www.upperdeckentertainment.com/tournament/rules.asp |website=Upper Deck Entertainment Tournament |publisher=Upper Deck Entertainment |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20030801074434/http://www.upperdeckentertainment.com:80/tournament/rules.asp |archive-date=1 August 2003}} This pack was later reprinted in 2004 for ''[[Master Collection Volume 1]]''. These cards include "EN" in their [[Set Number]]. ==Features== ''Legacy of Darkness'' introduced the [[Spirit monsters]] to the ''TCG''. It contains many [[Warrior]], [[Dragon]] and [[Fiend]]-[[Type]] monsters and support cards. Highly sought after cards include "[[Yata-Garasu]]", "[[Dark Ruler Ha Des]]", "[[Exiled Force]]", "[[Airknight Parshath]]", "[[Fiber Jar]]", "[[Injection Fairy Lily]]", and "[[Last Turn]]". ==Breakdown== In English and Asian-English, each pack contained 9 cards and each box contained 24 packs. In Korean, each pack contained 5 cards. The set contains 101 cards, comprised of: * 2 [[Secret Rare]] * 10 [[Ultra Rare]] * 10 [[Super Rare]] * 17 [[Rare]] * 62 [[Common]] ==Galleries== {{Main|Miscellaneous Gallery:Legacy of Darkness}} LOD-BoosterEN.png | Worldwide English
[[Set Card Galleries:Legacy of Darkness (TCG-EN-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] LOD-BoosterNA.png | North American English
[[Set Card Galleries:Legacy of Darkness (TCG-NA-1E)|1st Edition]] / [[Set Card Galleries:Legacy of Darkness (TCG-NA-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] LOD-BoosterAE.png | Asian-English
[[Set Card Galleries:Legacy of Darkness (OCG-AE-1E)|1st Edition]] LOD-BoosterKR.png | Korean
[[Set Card Galleries:Legacy of Darkness (OCG-KR-1E)|1st Edition]] / [[Set Card Galleries:Legacy of Darkness (OCG-KR-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] ==Lists== {{Set navigation | lists = EN, NA, AE, KR | 1e_galleries = NA, AE, KR | ue_galleries = EN, NA, KR }} {{Set list tabs|EN, NA, AE, KR}} ==References== {{Core Boosters}} [[Category:International Core Boosters]]

{{redirect|FET|the process for dealing with fast effects|Fast effect timing}} {{Infobox set | image = FET-BoosterEN.png | en_name = Flaming Eternity | fr_name = Éternité Brûlante | de_name = Flaming Eternity | it_name = Eternità Fiammeggiante | pt_name = Eternidade Flamejante | es_name = Eternidad Llameante | ja_name = フレイミング・エターニティ | romaji_name = Fureimingu Etāniti | ko_name = 영원한 화염 | hanja_name = | ko_rr_name = Yeong-wonhan Hwayeom | type = [[Booster Pack]] | series = Core Booster | size = 60 | cover_card = * [[Sacred Phoenix of Nephthys]] * [[Deck Devastation Virus]] | ja_database_id = 1107002 | en_database_id = 11104000 | fr_database_id = 31104000 | de_database_id = 21104000 | it_database_id = 41104000 | pt_database_id = 11104000 | es_database_id = 51103000 | ko_database_id = 71104002 | ae_database_id = 5000000023000 | order_number = 403 | prefix = FET | fr_prefix = FET-FR | it_prefix = FET-IT | pt_prefix = FET-PT | sp_prefix = FET-SP | ae_prefix = FET-AE | sneak_peek = yes | vendor_edition = yes | en_release_date = March 1, 2005 | jp_release_date = November 25, 2004 | ae_release_date = October 20, 2005 | kr_release_date = May 19, 2006 | fr/de/it/sp_release_date = March 1, 2005 | pt_release_date = March 1, 2005 | prev = Rise of Destiny | next = The Lost Millennium }} '''''Flaming Eternity''''' is a [[Core Booster]] in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Official Card Game]]'' (''OCG'') and ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game]]'' (''TCG''). It is the third Core Booster of [[Series 4]]. It has also been released in the ''TCG'' in English, French, German, Italian, Portuguese and Spanish and in the ''OCG'' in Japanese, [[Asian-English]] and Korean. In the ''TCG'', this set became legal for premier events on April 1, 2005.{{cite web |title=UDE-Turnier-Anhang Anhang A: Yu-Gi-Oh! TCG-Verfahrensweisen |url=http://www.upperdeckentertainment.com/op/policy/files/de/UDEAppendixAYGO04mar2005_de.pdf |publisher=Upper Deck Entertainment |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060108034805/http://www.upperdeckentertainment.com/op/policy/files/de/UDEAppendixAYGO04mar2005_de.pdf |archive-date=8 January 2006 |format=pdf |date=1 March 2005 |language=German}} This is one of the four Booster Packs combined into ''[[Dark Revelation Volume 3]]''. According to a [http://www.pojo.biz/board/showthread.php?t=292928 Pojo post] by [[Kevin Tewart]], this was the first Core Booster to have its boxes shrink-wrapped with the Konami logo. ==Features== * Includes cards used by [[Joey Wheeler]] and [[Noah Kaiba]]. * Includes members and/or support for the "[[LV]]" archetypes. * Introduces the "[[Hex-Sealed Fusion]] series, to the OCG/TCG. * This pack introduces support for [[Fusion Monster]]s, including the versatile "[[Hex-Sealed Fusion]]" Fusion substitute monsters * It also contains many [[Beast-Type]] monsters and support for them. * Highly sought-after cards include "[[Sacred Phoenix of Nephthys]]", "[[King Dragun]]", "[[Lightning Vortex]]" and "[[Phoenix Wing Wind Blast]]". ==Breakdown== In the Japanese version of this set, each pack contains 5 cards and each box contains 39 packs. In the ''TCG'' and Asian-English version, each pack contains 9 cards and each box contains 24 packs. In the Korean version, each pack contains 5 cards. In the Japanese version, the set contains 60 cards in total, or 71 in the [[Master Set]]. This is comprised of: * 11 [[Ultimate Rare]] * 4 [[Ultra Rare]] * 7 [[Super Rare]] * 14 [[Rare]] * 5 [[Normal Parallel Rare]] * 30 [[Common]] In the ''TCG'', Asian-English and Korean versions, the set contains 60 cards in total, or 85 in the [[Master Set]]. This is comprised of: * 25 [[Ultimate Rare]] * 4 [[Ultra Rare]] * 7 [[Super Rare]] * 14 [[Rare]] * 35 [[Common]] ==Galleries== FET-BoosterEN.png | English
[[Set Card Galleries:Flaming Eternity (TCG-EN-1E)|1st Edition]] / [[Set Card Galleries:Flaming Eternity (TCG-EN-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] FET-BoosterFR.jpg | French

[[Set Card Galleries:Flaming Eternity (OCG-KR-1E)|1st Edition]] / [[Set Card Galleries:Flaming Eternity (OCG-KR-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] FET-BoosterBoxEN.jpg | English Box FET-Poster-JP.png | Japanese promotional poster FET-Poster-EN.jpg | English promotional poster ==Lists== {{Set navigation | lists = EN,FR,DE,IT,PT,SP,JP,AE,KR | 1e_galleries = EN,FR,DE,IT,PT,SP,AE,KR | ue_galleries = EN,DE,JP,KR }} {{Set list tabs|EN,FR,DE,IT,PT,SP,JP,AE,KR}} ==References== ==External links== * [http://web.archive.org/web/20090226215944/http://entertainment.upperdeck.com/yugioh/en/products/boosters/FET.aspx entertainment.upperdeck.com] ''Flaming Eternity'' {{icon|archive}} * [http://konami-asia.com/th/yugi/lineup/en/duel_monsters/asia13 konami-asia.com] ''Flaming Eternity'' - Asian-English * [http://konami-asia.com/th/yugi/lineup/en/duel_monsters/flaming konami-asia.com] ''Flaming Eternity'' - Japanese * [http://www.yugioh.co.kr/01/01_03.php yugioh.co.kr] Booster Packs {{icon|Korean}} {{Core Boosters}} [[Category:OCG Core Boosters]] [[Category:TCG Core Boosters]]

{{Infobox set | image = SD1-DeckEN.png | en_name = Structure Deck: Dragon's Roar | fr_name = Deck de Structure: Rugissement des Dragons | de_name = Structure Deck: Dragon's Roar | it_name = Structure Deck: Ruggito del Drago | pt_name = Deck Estrutura: Rugído do Dragão | es_name = Baraja de Estructura: Rugido de Dragón | ja_name = ストラクチャーデッキ －ドラゴンの{{Ruby|力|ちから}}－ | romaji_name = Sutorakuchā Dekki - Doragon no Chikara - | ja_trans_name = Structure Deck - Dragon's Force - | ko_name = {{Ruby|ＳＴＲＵＣＴＵＲＥ ＤＥＣＫ|스트럭처 덱|lang=ko}} —드래곤의 힘— | ko_rr_name = Seuteuleogcheo Deg: Deulaegon-ui Him | ko_trans_name = Structure Deck: Dragon's Force | type = [[Structure Deck]] | prefix = SD1 | size = 40 | cover_card = [[Red-Eyes Darkness Dragon]] | ja_database_id = 2201008 | en_database_id = 14401000 | fr_database_id = 34401000 | de_database_id = 24401000 | it_database_id = 44401000 | pt_database_id = 14401000 | es_database_id = 54401000 | ko_database_id = 73301000 | jp_release_date = December 9, 2004 | kr_release_date = December 15, 2005 | na_release_date = January 1, 2005 | eu_release_date = | oc_release_date = | fr/de/it/sp_release_date = January 1, 2005 | pt_release_date = February 1, 2005 | sp-lat_release_date = | prev = ''[[Structure Deck: Marik (OCG)|Marik]]'' (''OCG'') | curr = ''Dragon's Roar'' | next = ''[[Structure Deck: Zombie Madness|Zombie Madness]]'' }} '''''Structure Deck: Dragon's Roar''''' is a [[Structure Deck]] in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Official Card Game]]'' (''OCG'') and ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game]]'' (''TCG''). It is the first deck in the ''OCG''{{'}}s Structure Deck series (ninth including the Character Structure Decks), following ''[[Structure Deck: Marik (OCG)|Structure Deck: Marik]]''. In the ''TCG'', it is the first deck. In the Korean ''OCG'', ''Structure Deck: Dragon's Roar'' was also released on December 15, 2005 bundled with ''[[Structure Deck: Zombie Madness]]'' as the ''[[Structure Deck: Special Set]]''. {{Quote| Upper Deck Entertainment|Ferocious [[Dragon]]s and ravaging [[Zombie]]s clash in these two new [[Structure Deck]]s. The [[Structure Deck]]s are tournament tough, ready to play with out of the box with powerful hard to find cards. Each [[Deck]] contains 40 cards, including one brand new [[Ultra Rare]] monster, rulebook, and Dueling guide which assists a Duelist in taking his game to the next level.}} ==Features== The Deck features [[Dragon]]-[[Type]] monsters, with cards used by [[Nightshroud]], [[Atticus Rhodes]] and [[Chazz Princeton]]. Significant cards include "[[Red-Eyes Darkness Dragon]]", "[[Creature Swap]]" and "[[Armed Dragon LV5]]". The "Let's Power Up This Deck! (With Booster Packs)" supplement suggests combining this Deck with "[[Buster Blader]]" from ''[[Dark Beginning 1]]''; "[[Judgement of Anubis]]" from ''[[Dark Revelation Volume 1]]''; "[[Inferno Fire Blast]]", "[[Armed Dragon LV7]]", and "[[Level Up!]]" from ''[[Soul of the Duelist]]''; and "[[Covering Fire]]", "[[Mirage Dragon]]", "[[Mystic Swordsman LV6]]" and "[[Monster Reincarnation]]" from ''[[Rise of Destiny]]'' ("Armed Dragon LV7" is also available as a promotional card in ''[[Structure Deck: Deluxe Edition]]''). "[[Horus the Black Flame Dragon]]" is shown, but not described. ==Breakdown== Each ''Structure Deck: Dragon's Roar'' contains: * 1 Preconstructed Deck of 40 cards ** 1 [[Ultra Rare]] ** 39 [[Common]]s * 1 [[Rulebook]] * 1 Dueling Guide * 1 [[Playmat]] ==Galleries== SD1-DeckEN.png | English
[[Set Card Galleries:Structure Deck: Dragon's Roar (TCG-EN-1E)|1st Edition]] / [[Set Card Galleries:Structure Deck: Dragon's Roar (TCG-EN-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] SD1-DeckFR.png | French
[[Set Card Galleries:Structure Deck: Dragon's Roar (TCG-FR-1E)|1st Edition]] SD1-DeckDE.png | German
[[Set Card Galleries:Structure Deck: Dragon's Roar (TCG-DE-1E)|1st Edition]] SD1-DeckIT.png | Italian
[[Set Card Galleries:Structure Deck: Dragon's Roar (TCG-IT-1E)|1st Edition]] SD1-DeckPT.png | Portuguese
[[Set Card Galleries:Structure Deck: Dragon's Roar (TCG-PT-1E)|1st Edition]] SD1-DeckSP.png | Spanish
[[Set Card Galleries:Structure Deck: Dragon's Roar (TCG-SP-1E)|1st Edition]] SD1-DeckJP.png | Japanese
[[Set Card Galleries:Structure Deck: Dragon's Roar (OCG-JP)|Unlimited Edition]] SD1-DeckKR.png | Korean
[[Set Card Galleries:Structure Deck: Dragon's Roar (OCG-KR-1E)|1st Edition]] / [[Set Card Galleries:Structure Deck: Dragon's Roar (OCG-KR-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] SD1&SD2-Poster-JP.png | Japanese promotional poster ==Lists== {{Set navigation | lists = EN,FR,DE,IT,PT,SP,JP,KR | 1e_galleries = EN,FR,DE,IT,PT,SP,KR | ue_galleries = EN,JP,KR }} {{Set list tabs|EN,FR,DE,IT,PT,SP,JP,KR}} {{Decks}} [[Category:OCG Structure Decks|Dragon's Roar]] [[Category:TCG Structure Decks|Dragon's Roar]]

{{Infobox set | image = SD2-DeckEN.png | en_name = Structure Deck: Zombie Madness | fr_name = Deck de Structure: Folie Zombie | de_name = Structure Deck: Zombie Madness | it_name = Structure Deck: Follia Zombie | pt_name = Deck Estrutura: Insanidade Zumbi | es_name = Baraja de Estructura: Locura de Zombi | ja_name = ストラクチャーデッキ －アンデットの{{Ruby|脅|きょう}}{{Ruby|威|い}}－ | romaji_name = Sutorakuchā Dekki - Andetto no Kyōi - | ja_trans_name = Structure Deck - Undead Threat - | ko_name = {{Ruby|ＳＴＲＵＣＴＵＲＥ ＤＥＣＫ|스트럭처 덱|lang=ko}} —언데드의 위협— | ko_rr_name = Seuteuleogcheo Deg - Eondedeuui Wihyeob - | ko_trans_name = Structure Deck: Undead Threat | type = [[Structure Deck]] | prefix = SD2 | size = 40 | cover_card = [[Vampire Genesis]] | ja_database_id = 2201009 | en_database_id = 14401001 | fr_database_id = 34401001 | de_database_id = 24401001 | it_database_id = 44401001 | pt_database_id = 14401001 | es_database_id = 54401001 | ko_database_id = 73301001 | jp_release_date = December 9, 2004 | kr_release_date = December 15, 2005 | na_release_date = January 1, 2005 | eu_release_date = | oc_release_date = | fr/de/it/sp_release_date = January 1, 2005 | pt_release_date = February 1, 2005 | sp-lat_release_date = | prev = ''[[Structure Deck: Dragon's Roar|Dragon's Roar]]'' | curr = ''Zombie Madness'' | next = ''[[Structure Deck: Blaze of Destruction|Blaze of Destruction]]'' }} '''''Structure Deck: Zombie Madness''''' is a [[Structure Deck]] in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Official Card Game]]'' (''OCG'') and ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game]]'' (''TCG''). It is the second deck in the ''OCG''{{'}}s Structure Deck series (tenth including the Character Structure Decks), following ''[[Structure Deck: Dragon's Roar]]''. In the ''TCG'', it is the second deck. In the Korean ''OCG'', ''Structure Deck: Zombie Madness'' was also released on December 15, 2005 bundled with ''[[Structure Deck: Dragon's Roar]]'' as the ''[[Structure Deck: Special Set]]''. {{Quote|[http://www.upperdeckentertainment.com/yugioh/en/products/structuredecks/SD2.aspx Upper Deck Entertainment]|Ferocious [[Dragon]]s and ravaging [[Zombie]]s clash in these two new [[Structure Deck]]s. The [[Structure Deck]]s are tournament tough, ready to play with out of the box with powerful hard to find cards. Each [[Deck]] contains 40 cards, including one brand new [[Ultra Rare]] monster, rulebook, and Dueling guide which assists a Duelist in taking his game to the next level.}} ==Features== The deck features [[Zombie]]-[[Type]] monsters, with feature cards including "[[Vampire Genesis]]", "[[Dark Dust Spirit]]", and "[[Call of the Mummy]]". The "Let's Power Up This Deck! (With Booster Packs)" supplement suggests combining this Deck with "[[Hallowed Life Barrier]]" from ''[[Soul of the Duelist]]''; "[[Serial Spell]]" from ''[[Rise of Destiny]]''; "[[Red-Moon Baby]]", "[[Tribute to the Doomed]]", "[[Painful Choice]]" and "[[Premature Burial]]" from ''[[Dark Beginning 1]]''; and "[[Fear from the Dark]]", "[[Dark Core]]", "[[Rope of Life]]" and "[[Judgement of Anubis]]" from ''[[Dark Revelation Volume 1]]'' ("Rope of Life" is also available as a promotional card in ''[[Structure Deck: Deluxe Edition]]''). ==Breakdown== Each ''Structure Deck: Zombie Madness'' contains: * 1 Preconstructed Deck of 40 cards ** 1 [[Ultra Rare]] ** 39 [[Common]]s * 1 [[Rulebook]] * 1 Dueling Guide * 1 [[Playmat]] ==Galleries== {{See also|Miscellaneous Gallery:Structure Deck: Zombie Madness}} SD2-DeckEN.png | English
[[Set Card Galleries:Structure Deck: Zombie Madness (TCG-EN-1E)|1st Edition]] / [[Set Card Galleries:Structure Deck: Zombie Madness (TCG-EN-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] SD2-DeckFR.png | French

[[Set Card Galleries:Structure Deck: Zombie Madness (OCG-KR-1E)|1st Edition]] / [[Set Card Galleries:Structure Deck: Zombie Madness (OCG-KR-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] ==Lists== {{Set navigation | lists = EN,FR,DE,IT,PT,SP,JP,KR | 1e_galleries = EN,FR,DE,IT,PT,SP,KR | ue_galleries = EN,JP,KR }} {{Set list tabs|EN,FR,DE,IT,PT,SP,JP,KR}} {{Decks}} [[Category:OCG Structure Decks|Zombie Madness]] [[Category:TCG Structure Decks|Zombie Madness]]

{{About|the 2002 ''TCG'', Korean and Asian-English preconstructed Deck|the 2001 Japanese preconstructed Deck|''Structure Deck: Yugi''|the 2016 preconstructed Deck|''Structure Deck: Yugi Muto''}} {{Infobox set | image = SDY-DeckNA.png | en_name = Starter Deck: Yugi | fr_name = Deck de Démarrage: Yugi | de_name = Starter Deck: Yugi | it_name = Mazzo Introduttivo: Yugi | pt_name = Deck Inicial do Yugi | es_name = Baraja de Inicio: Yugi | ko_name = {{Ruby|ＳＴＡＲＴＥＲ ＤＥＣＫ|스타터 덱|lang=ko}} —유희 편— | ko_rr_name = Seutateo Deg: Yuhui Pyeon | ko_trans_name = Starter Deck: Yugi Edition | type = [[Starter Deck]] | size = * 50 * 46 (E, F, G, I) | en_database_id = 13301000 | fr_database_id = 33301001 | de_database_id = 23301000 | it_database_id = 43301001 | pt_database_id = 13301000 | es_database_id = 53301001 | ko_database_id = 72201001 | ae_database_id = 5000000001000 | cover_card = [[Dark Magician]] | na_prefix = SDY | eu_prefix = SDY-E | oc_prefix = SDY-A | fr_prefix = DDY-F | fc_prefix = DDY-C | de_prefix = SDY-G | it_prefix = MIY-I | pt_prefix = DIY-P | sp_prefix = BIY-S | ae_prefix = SDY | kr_prefix = SDY-K | ae_release_date = August 8, 2002 | kr_release_date = December 9, 2003 | na_release_date = March 29, 2002 | eu_release_date = December 2002 | oc_release_date = September 2003 | fr_release_date = March 26, 2003 | fc_release_date = July 26, 2003 | de_release_date = April 25, 2003 | it_release_date = September 2003 | pt_release_date = June 2004 | sp_release_date = October 2003 | curr = ''Yugi'' | next = ''[[Starter Deck: Kaiba|Kaiba]]'' }} '''''Starter Deck: Yugi''''' is a [[Starter Deck]] in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game]]'' (''TCG''). Released alongside ''[[Starter Deck: Kaiba]]'', they are the first and second deck in the ''TCG''{{'}}s Starter Deck series. It is also released in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Official Card Game]]'' (''OCG'') in [[Asian-English]] and Korean. The set has been released in the ''Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game'' (''TCG'') in three different English prints—North American, European and Oceanic—as well as in European French, French-Canadian, German, Italian, Portuguese and Spanish. The European English, European French, German and Italian sets contain less cards than the other prints, each including 46 instead of 50 cards. "[[Summoned Skull]]" from this set was previously distributed privately as a [[Summoned Skull Sample promotional card|sample card]], as well as given away in the ''Kids' WB!'' "[[Duelin' Monsters Giveaway]]" in November 2001. In both cases, the card was printed using glossy paper like used for ''OCG'' cards, and their [[card text]] was line-wrapped in a different position; in addition, the sample card had the word "SAMPLE" printed on its [[card backing]], while the giveaway promo lacked the [[Eye of Anubis Hologram]] in its lower right corner. ==Features== The deck contains cards selected from the Japanese ''[[EX Starter Box|EX]]'' and ''[[EX-R Starter Box|EX-R]]'' Starter Boxes. ==Breakdown== In the North American English, Oceanic English, French-Canadian, Portuguese, Spanish, Asian-English and Korean versions, each ''Starter Deck: Yugi'' contains 50 cards in total. The number of card of each rarity are as follows: * 1 [[Ultra Rare]] * 2 [[Super Rare]]s * 47 [[Common]]s In the European English, French, German and Italian versions, each ''Starter Deck: Yugi'' contains 46 cards in total. The number of card of each rarity are as follows: * 1 [[Ultra Rare]] * 2 [[Super Rare]]s * 43 [[Common]]s The missing cards would later be included in European releases of ''[[Magic Ruler]]'': * "[[Beaver Warrior]]" (MRL-E103) * "[[Mammoth Graveyard]]" (MRL-E104) * "[[Neo the Magic Swordsman]]" (MRL-E105) * "[[Man-Eating Treasure Chest]]" (MRL-E106) ==Galleries== {{Main|Miscellaneous Gallery:Starter Deck: Yugi}} SDY-DeckNA.png | North American English
[[Set Card Galleries:Starter Deck: Yugi (TCG-NA-1E)|1st Edition]] / [[Set Card Galleries:Starter Deck: Yugi (TCG-NA-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] SDY-DeckEU.png | European English
[[Set Card Galleries:Starter Deck: Yugi (TCG-EU-1E)|1st Edition]] / [[Set Card Galleries:Starter Deck: Yugi (TCG-EU-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] SDY-DeckAU.png | Oceanic English
[[Set Card Galleries:Starter Deck: Yugi (TCG-AU-1E)|1st Edition]] / [[Set Card Galleries:Starter Deck: Yugi (TCG-AU-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] DDY-DeckFR.png | French
[[Set Card Galleries:Starter Deck: Yugi (TCG-FR-1E)|1st Edition]] / [[Set Card Galleries:Starter Deck: Yugi (TCG-FR-UE)|Unlimited Edition]] DDY-DeckFC.png | French-Canadian

Trading Card Game to the U.S. market] {{Starter and Structure Decks}} [[Category:OCG Starter Decks|Yugi]] [[Category:TCG Starter Decks|Yugi]]

pages.title: Structure Deck: Fury from the Deep

revisions.content:
{{Infobox set | image = SD4-DeckEN.png | en_name = Structure Deck: Fury from the Deep | fr_name = Deck de Structure: Fureur des Profondeurs | de_name = Structure Deck: Fury from the Deep | it_name = Structure Deck: Furia degli Abissi | pt_name = Deck Estrutura: Fúria das Profundezas | es_name = Baraja de Estructura: Furia de las Profundidades | ja_name = ストラクチャーデッキ －{{Ruby|海|かい}}{{Ruby|竜|りゅう}}{{Ruby|神|しん}}の{{Ruby|怒|いか}}り－ | romaji_name = Sutorakuchā Dekki - Kairyūshin no Ikari - | ja_trans_name = Structure Deck - Fury of the Sea Dragon God - | ko_name = {{Ruby|ＳＴＲＵＣＴＵＲＥ ＤＥＣＫ|스트럭처 덱|lang=ko}} —해룡신의 분노— | ko_rr_name = Seuteuleogcheo Deg - Haelyongsin-ui Bunno - | ko_trans_name = Structure Deck: Fury of the Sea Dragon God | type = [[Structure Deck]] | prefix = SD4 | size = 40 | cover_card = [[Ocean Dragon Lord - Neo-Daedalus]] | ja_database_id = 2201011 | en_database_id = 14401003 | fr_database_id = 34401002 | de_database_id = 24401003 | it_database_id = 44401003 | pt_database_id = 14401003 | es_database_id = 54401003 | ko_database_id = 73302001 | jp_release_date = March 17, 2005 | kr_release_date = April 29, 2006 | na_release_date = May 2005 | eu_release_date = | oc_release_date = | fr/de/it/sp_release_date = May 2005 | pt_release_date = May 1, 2005 | sp-lat_release_date = | prev = ''[[Structure Deck: Blaze of Destruction|Blaze of Destruction]]'' | curr = ''Fury from the Deep'' | next = ''[[Structure Deck: Warrior's Triumph|Warrior's Triumph]]'' }} '''''Structure Deck: Fury from the Deep''''' is a [[Structure Deck]] in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Official Card Game]]'' (''OCG'') and ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game]]'' (''TCG''). It is the fourth deck in the ''OCG''{{'}}s Structure Deck series (twelfth including the Character Structure Decks), following ''[[Structure Deck: Blaze of Destruction]]''. In the ''[[TCG]]'', it is the fourth deck. In the Korean ''OCG'', ''Structure Deck: Fury of the Deep'' was first released on April 29, 2006 in the bundle ''[[Structure Deck: Special Set 2]]'' (with ''Structure Deck: Blaze of Destruction''). It was released individually on May 10, 2006. ==Description== {{Quote|[http://www.upperdeckentertainment.com/yugioh/en/products/structuredecks/SD4.aspx Upper Deck Entertainment]|It's a struggle of the [[attribute|elements]] with the two new [[Structure Deck]]s. Control the waves and crush your opponents with "Fury from the Deep" or leave them standing in a cloud of smoke with the [[Fire|FIRE]] monsters of "[[Structure Deck: Blaze of Destruction|Blaze of Destruction]]". The [[Structure Deck]]s are ready to play with out of the box, so you can master their new strategies. Each [[Deck]] has 40 cards with 1 brand new [[Ultra Rare]] [[Monster Card]], rulebook, and Dueling guide which assists a Duelist in taking his game to the next level.}} ==Features== The deck features [[Water|WATER]] monsters. Featured cards include "[[Ocean Dragon Lord - Neo-Daedalus]]", "[[Gravity Bind]]", and "[[Tribe-Infecting Virus]]". ==Breakdown== Each ''Structure Deck: Fury from the Deep'' contains: * 1 Preconstructed Deck of 40 cards ** 1 [[Ultra Rare]] ** 39 [[Common]]s * 1 [[Rulebook]] * 1 Dueling Guide * 1 [[Playmat]] ==Galleries== SD4-DeckEN.png | English
